verses.roman:
taṁ labdhvā lubdhakaḥ krūraḥ
kapotaṁ gṛha-medhinam
kapotakān kapotīṁ ca
siddhārthaḥ prayayau gṛham

synonyms: tam—him; labdhvā—taking; lubdhakaḥ—the hunter; krūraḥ—cruel; kapotam—the pigeon; gṛha-medhinam—the materialistic householder; kapotakān—the pigeon children; kapotīm—the pigeon wife; ca—also; siddha-arthaḥ—having achieved his purposes; prayayau—he set off; gṛham—for his home.
translation: The cruel hunter, having fulfilled his desire by capturing the head pigeon, his wife and all of their children, set off for his own home.
